title: Eligibility for licensure
context: §468E-5 Eligibility for licensure. To be eligible for licensure by the board as a speech pathologist or audiologist, a person shall: (1) Possess at least a master&rsquo;s degree or its equivalent in the area of speech pathology or audiology, as the case may be, from an educational institution recognized by the board; (2) Submit to the board evidence of eligibility for meeting the requirements of the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association for the certificate of clinical competence in speech pathology or audiology, or both; and (3) Pass a written examination approved by the board. [L 1974, c 48, pt of §1; am L 1978, c 21, §1; am L 1988, c 320, §4; am L 1996, c 13, §14]
